conclusion: Analyze the motion of negatively charged particles in a magnetic field to determine velocity when reaching collection device.
Particles move in circular paths due to Lorentz force; goal is to determine velocity v1 on positive x-axis.
Magnetic force acts as centripetal force: F = qvB = mv^2/r, leading to r = mv/qB.
Charge-to-mass ratio given as q/m = 2 x 10^6 C/kg.
Substitute q/m into r formula: r = v/(q/m B) = v/(2 x 10^6)(5 x 10^-3).
Particle source S is located at (0, d), where d = 1.2 m.
Particles emitted at angle θ = 48.5° follow a circular trajectory due to magnetic field.
Radius of circular motion is r = 10^-4v.
For collision with collection device, particle must travel horizontally to x-axis after half circular trajectory.
Vertical distance d corresponds to diameter of circular motion: d = 2r.
Substitute r = 10^-4v into d = 2r: d = 2(10^-4v) = 2 x 10^-4v.
Rearrange to find v: v = d/(2 x 10^-4).
Particles collide with collection device after half circular trajectory; velocity is purely horizontal and equal to initial velocity v.
Final answer: particle velocity v1 when reaching collection device is 6000 m/s.
